Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 8 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

details.value:
Why work for Pani?

As an Implementation Specialist co-op student at Pani, you will play a crucial role in driving our success by collaborating across departments to implement digital twins of our customers' plants and deliver tailored use cases within Pani's proprietary software system. You will receive training and have the opportunity to develop a diverse set of highly sought-after skills, including process engineering, Python coding and scripting, as well as expertise in water treatment engineering and processes. We don't do 'co-op projects' at Pani; you will be completely part of the team.

About You

You have a passion for engineering and enjoy the challenge of working on innovative projects with an equally talented group of co-workers who will both challenge and support you. You believe in lifelong learning and welcome the opportunity to constantly iterate and improve upon your skills. Fundamentally you want to use your talents and energy to better the world for others and contribute to the responsible management of global water and energy, and CO2 reduction.

What you bring to the team

3rd or 4th year student in a technical field such as mechanical, chemical, process, software or environmental engineering or equivalent experience
8 month minimum commitment (this is non negotiable)
Experience coding with Python for scripting and automating simple tasks.
Familiarity with reading and interpreting Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID), Process Flow Diagrams (PFD), Block Flow Diagrams (BFD), and SCADA systems.
A strong drive to ask "why" questions, demonstrating a curious mindset and a desire to understand the work deeply.
Comfort in working directly with stakeholders, fostering collaborative relationships.
Proactive in seeking clarification when faced with ambiguity, ensuring a clear understanding of tasks.
An aptitude for identifying communication gaps and miscommunication, contributing to effective collaboration.
High general intelligence and exceptional problem-solving abilities, capable of navigating complex challenges.
Excellent organizational skills, particularly in process management, to enhance operational efficiency.

Responsibilities

Review and interpret P&IDs, process flow diagrams, and datasheet of equipment (pumps, blowers, sensors, etc.)
Perform initial exploration, cleaning, and quality assessment of historical plant data
Update and execute Python and terminal line scripts and commands throughout the plant onboarding process.
Write and debug Python automation scripts used throughout the plant onboarding process.
Understand the design and control of water treatment plants and processes and apply this knowledge to set up key performance indicators (KPIs) and optimization models
Use Pani's toolbox to configure KPIs and models, set up charts, and custom reports
Analyze sensor data from plants and identify errors or anomalies
Use engineering analysis and software unit testing to verify your own work and check the work of others
Work with the engineering and software development teams to develop and improve internal onboarding tools to make the onboarding process more efficient

Nice to Have

Previous experience working for a SaaS startup
Candidates based in the Pacific time zone, particularly those local to Victoria, are strongly preferred.
